acceptance-test-run.title: Podam should handle both native and wrapped byte values with @PodamByteValue annotation
acceptance-test-run.name: podamShouldHandleByteValuesWithThePodamByteValueAnnotation

test-step.description: When I invoke the factory manufacturing for <span class='step-parameter'>class uk.co.jemos.podam.test.dto.annotations.ByteValuePojo

Then the Object ByteRangeValuesPojo ( byteFieldWithMinValueOnly = 0 byteFieldWithMaxValueOnly = 90 byteFieldWithMinAndMaxValue = 37 byteObjectFieldWithMinValueOnly = 0 byteObjectFieldWithMaxValueOnly = 15 byteObjectFieldWithMinAndMaxValue = 53 byteFieldWithPreciseValue = 12 ) should not be null
Then the byte value 0 should be greater or equal than 0
Then the byte value 90 should be lower or equal to 100
Then the byte value 37 should be between 0 and 100
Then the Object 0 should not be null
Then the byte value 0 should be greater or equal than 0
Then the Object 90 should not be null
Then the byte value 15 should be lower or equal to 100
Then the Object 53 should not be null
Then the byte value 53 should be between 0 and 100
The byte value 12 should be precisely 12
